file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 53-04-30-04 - CONFIG-1 - REAR WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL REAR WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the Rear Wing-to-Fuselage Fairing. B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) REAR WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - 53-04-30-000-801-A EMB-145 REMOVAL ACFT MODEL(S) REAR WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - 53-04-30-400-801-A EMB-145 INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-1 53-04-30 Page 1 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-04-30-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 2. REAR WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the Rear Wing-to-Fuselage Fairing. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - SRM 51-20-01-PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193AL Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area 193 193LL Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area 193 193BL (LH side) Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area 193 193CR (RH side) Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Acrylic spatula To remove sealant available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - MEK AR G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 53-04-30 Page 2 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 3 Do the task Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-014-B (1) Put the aircraft on safe condition for maintenance. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-014-B (1) With an acrylic spatula, remove the old aerodynamic sealant in the rear wing-to- fuselage attachment area. (2) Refer to (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100) and remove the hydraulic compartment access panels. – 193BL (LH side) (5). – 193CR (RH side) (1). WARNING: THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE GOGGLES AND RUBBER GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (3) Remove the clamps (LH and RH sides) which connect the flexible hose to the hydraulic compartment drain. (4) Remove the clamps (LH and RH sides) which connect the drain to the air-scoop outlet ducts. (5) Remove the 193AL access panel (6). Refer to (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (6) Remove the 193LL access panel (3). Refer to (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (7) Remove the clamp which connects the drain to the drain valve hose. (8) Remove the screws (8) that attach the splices (LH and RH side) (7) to the fairings. (9) Remove the splices (7) from the interface between the center and the rear wing-to- fuselage fairings (2). (10) Remove the screws (4) that attach the rear wing-to-fuselage fairing (2). (11) Remove the rear wing-to-fuselage fairing (2). NOTE: Make sure that the interface sealing is not damaged. If necessary, apply sealant again. Refer to (SRM 51-20-01-PR). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 53-04-30 Page 3 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 53-04-30-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-145 3. REAR WING-TO-FUSELAGE FAIRING - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the rear wing-to-fuselage fairing. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM MPP 06-41-01/100 - AMM MPP 20-10-01/200 - MAINTENANCE PRACTICES ELECTRICAL BONDING TEST - STANDARD PROCE- AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/200 DURES AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600 - IPC 53-04-00 FAIRINGS WING/FUSELAGE SRM 51-20-01-PR - C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 193 193AL Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area 193 193LL Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area 193 193BL (LH side) Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area 193 193CR (RH side) Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area D. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Torque wrench To tighten the screws available E. Auxiliary Items ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY Commercially Protective Gloves For protection of technician's hands 1 available Commercially Safety Goggles For protection of technician's eyes 1 available F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-G-46886 Grease, Molykote DC-33, Light AR MIL-PRF-81733 TYPE II-2 Sealant, P/S 870 - B 2 AR EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 53-04-30 Page 6 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (Continued) SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MIL-PRF-81733 TYPE II-1/2 Sealant, P/S 870 - B 1/2 AR Commercially available Adhesive Tape AR Commercially available Aluminum Tape (AL Tape 425) AR Commercially available Polyethylene Film AR ASTM-D-740 Methyl Ethyl Ketone - MEK AR Commercially available Scotch Brite Sponge AR G. Expendable Parts IPC REFERENCE ITEM QTY (VENDOR REFERENCE) Gasket IPC 53-04-00 AR H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 3 Do the task Rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area I. Installation (Figure 401) (Figure 402) SUBTASK 420-014-B CAUTION: THE INSPECTION OF FUEL QUANTITY INDICATION HARNESS IS PART OF CRITICAL DESIGN CONFIGURATION CONTROL LIMITATIONS (CDCCL) IN THE AIRWORTHINESS LIMITATIONS OF THE AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE PROGRAM. (1) Do an inspection on the fuel quantity indication harness, according to AMM TASK 28-41-00-200-801-A/600. WARNING: THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM CONTAINS PHOSPHATE-ESTER HYDRAULIC FLUID. THE FLUID CAN CAUSE IRRITATION IN YOUR SKIN OR INJURY TO YOUR EYES. USE THE APPLICABLE GOGGLES AND RUBBER GLOVES. IF THE FLUID TOUCHES YOU, FLUSH YOUR SKIN WITH WATER. IF IT GETS IN YOUR EYES, FLUSH THEM WITH WATER AND GET MEDICAL HELP. (2) Apply molykote DC-33 light grease to the faying surface of the rear wing-to-fuselage (3). (3) Install the rear wing-to-fuselage fairing (2). (4) Install the screws (4) that attach the rear wing-to-fuselage fairing (2). NOTE: For torque, refer to (AMM MPP 20-10-01/200). (5) Install the clamps to connect the flexible hose to the hydraulic compartment drain. (6) Install the clamps (LH and RH sides) to connect the drain to the air-scoop outlet hose. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 53-04-30 Page 7 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (7) Install the clamp to connect the drain to the drain valve hose. (8) Install the splices (7) at the interface between the center and the rear wing-to-fuselage fairings (2). (9) Install the screws (8) that attach the splices (LH and RH side) (7) to the fairings. (10) Install the hydraulic compartment access panels (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100): – 193BL (LH side) (5). – 193CR (RH side) (1). (11) Install the 193AL access panel (6) (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (12) Install the 193LL access panel (3) (AMM MPP 06-41-01/100). (13) There are different methods to do the aerodynamic sealing in the rear wing-to-fuselage attachment area. Use the applicable procedure as necessary. (a) Full sealant-curing time: 1 Apply sealant P/S 870 - B 1/2 or P/S 870 - B 2. NOTE: Sealant curing time will change according to the environmental conditions. Refer to (SRM 51-20-01-PR). (b) Acceleration of the sealant curing time with heating: 1 Apply sealant P/S 870 - B 1/2 or P/S 870 - B 2. 2 Wait for one hour after the sealant is applied. CAUTION: THE TEMPERATURE MUST NOT BE HIGHER THAN 55ÃÂ°C (131ÃÂ°F). 3 Heat the area which received the sealant. NOTE: Sealant curing time will change according to the environmental conditions. Refer to (SRM 51-20-01-PR). (c) Application of aluminum tape after the tack-free time. NOTE: This procedure must only be done when a faster aircraft clearance is necessary. 1 Apply sealant P/S 870 - B 1/2 or P/S 870 - B 2. 2 You can accelerate the sealant curing time as written in paragraph (b). 3 After the sealant is tack-free, apply aluminum tape. NOTE: You can operate the aircraft immediately after the aluminum tape application. 4 Remove the aluminum tape after 150 hours. (d) Application of polyethylene film and aluminum tape. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 53-04-30 Page 8 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL 1 Apply sealant P/S 870 - B 1/2 or P/S 870 - B 2. 2 Apply a polyethylene film over the sealant. 3 Apply the aluminum tape. NOTE: You can operate the aircraft immediately after the aluminum tape application. 4 Remove the aluminum tape after 10 days. J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-014-B (1) Do the electrical-bonding test procedure as given in AMM TASK 20-13-21-700-801-A/ 200. Refer to (Figure 402). (2) Do the procedure to put the aircraft back to initial condition. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 CONFIG-1 53-04-30 Page 9 of 9 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
